body:
## Expected Behavior
The temporal-sql-tool has a flag `--version` which outputs `0.0.1`. This `--version` flag is inherited by default from https://github.com/urfave/cli/tree/main (the package that the tool uses to standardize the UX for CLIs).

This is where the value for the temporal-sql-tool version is set: https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/c762ad2ee285fda23497af32a8c0fb7988239b81/tools/sql/main.go#L36

Similarly, this is where the value for the temporal-cassandra-tool version is set: https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/c762ad2ee285fda23497af32a8c0fb7988239b81/tools/cassandra/main.go#L36

Note: since the variable is set within a function's scope, it is not possible to use `go build -ldflags "-X 'some_package.Version=1.2.3'" ./cmd/tools/sql` to set a version for the tool when compiling it with `go`.

Additionally, this raises a bigger question of how the `temporal-sql-tool` and `temporal-cassandra-tool` should be versioned (should they be versioned in step with the `temporal-server`? or should the versioning of these tools be incremented independently - if so, how to properly and easily allow one to inspect the precise code branch for a given version of the tool?)

## Actual Behavior
The `--version` flag outputs a meaningful and correct version.

## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

  1. docker run -it temporalio/admin-tools bash
  2. $ temporal-sql-tool --version
  3. $ temporal-cassandra-tool --version

## Specifications

  - Version: n/a
  - Platform: linux (ubuntu)

comments.body:
Good point.
We should make sure we properly set the versions when we build these tools.
We will likely fold these tools into `tdbg` sub commands instead of maintaining separate binaries.

title: Lack of versioning for temporal-sql-tool and temporal-cassandra-tool
